00015 #include "build_log.h"
00016 
00017 #include "test.h"
00018 
00019 static const char kTestFilename[] = "BuildLogTest-tempfile";
00020 
00021 struct BuildLogTest : public StateTestWithBuiltinRules {
00022   virtual void SetUp() {
00023   }
00024   virtual void TearDown() {
00025     unlink(kTestFilename);
00026   }
00027 };
00028 
00029 TEST_F(BuildLogTest, WriteRead) {
00030   AssertParse(&state_,
00031 "build out: cat mid\n"
00032 "build mid: cat in\n");
00033 
00034   BuildLog log1;
00035   string err;
00036   EXPECT_TRUE(log1.OpenForWrite(kTestFilename, &err));
00037   ASSERT_EQ("", err);
00038   log1.RecordCommand(state_.edges_[0], 15, 18);
00039   log1.RecordCommand(state_.edges_[1], 20, 25);
00040   log1.Close();
00041 
00042   BuildLog log2;
00043   EXPECT_TRUE(log2.Load(kTestFilename, &err));
00044   ASSERT_EQ("", err);
00045 
00046   ASSERT_EQ(2u, log1.log_.size());
00047   ASSERT_EQ(2u, log2.log_.size());
00048   BuildLog::LogEntry* e1 = log1.LookupByOutput("out");
00049   ASSERT_TRUE(e1);
00050   BuildLog::LogEntry* e2 = log2.LookupByOutput("out");
00051   ASSERT_TRUE(e2);
00052   ASSERT_TRUE(*e1 == *e2);
00053   ASSERT_EQ(15, e1->start_time);
00054   ASSERT_EQ("out", e1->output);
00055 }
00056 
00057 TEST_F(BuildLogTest, DoubleEntry) {
00058   FILE* f = fopen(kTestFilename, "wb");
00059   fprintf(f, "0 out command abc\n");
00060   fprintf(f, "0 out command def\n");
00061   fclose(f);
00062 
00063   string err;
00064   BuildLog log;
00065   EXPECT_TRUE(log.Load(kTestFilename, &err));
00066   ASSERT_EQ("", err);
00067 
00068   BuildLog::LogEntry* e = log.LookupByOutput("out");
00069   ASSERT_TRUE(e);
00070   ASSERT_EQ("command def", e->command);
00071 }
00072 
00073 TEST_F(BuildLogTest, Truncate) {
00074   AssertParse(&state_,
00075 "build out: cat mid\n"
00076 "build mid: cat in\n");
00077 
00078   BuildLog log1;
00079   string err;
00080   EXPECT_TRUE(log1.OpenForWrite(kTestFilename, &err));
00081   ASSERT_EQ("", err);
00082   log1.RecordCommand(state_.edges_[0], 15, 18);
00083   log1.RecordCommand(state_.edges_[1], 20, 25);
00084   log1.Close();
00085 
00086   struct stat statbuf;
00087   ASSERT_EQ(0, stat(kTestFilename, &statbuf));
00088   ASSERT_GT(statbuf.st_size, 0);
00089 
00090   // For all possible truncations of the input file, assert that we don't
00091   // crash or report an error when parsing.
00092   for (off_t size = statbuf.st_size; size > 0; --size) {
00093     ASSERT_EQ(0, truncate(kTestFilename, size));
00094 
00095     BuildLog log2;
00096     EXPECT_TRUE(log2.Load(kTestFilename, &err));
00097     ASSERT_EQ("", err);
00098   }
00099 }
